constructor.details: The Approval Authority is currently the address that  instantiates the contract, represented by the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE through OpenZeppelin's AccessControl.sol. Future progress should  allow graceful transfer and addition of Approval Authority.

params._DR: The index of the specified Discrepancy Report
params._state: State selection, only accepted or declined are valid

params._DR: The index of the specified Discrepancy Report
params._state: State selection, only rejected or fixed are valid

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

params._DR: The index of the specified Discrepancy Report

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._contentOwner: The owner of the content the DR is written against
params._discrepancy: Complaint about the content from the submitter

devdoc.title: A managment tool to track Discrepancy Report lifecycles

LogAcceptance(uint256).notice: Logs acceptance of Discrepancy Report validity

LogDeclination(uint256).notice: Logs declination of Discrepancy Report validity

LogFixed(uint256).notice: Logs acceptance of a Discrepancy Report resolution

LogRejected(uint256).notice: Logs rejection of a Discrepancy Report resolution

LogResolved(uint256).notice: Log that a Discrepancy Report has been resolved by the content owner.

LogSubmission(uint256).notice: Logs submission of a new Discrepancy Report

determineValidity(uint256,uint8).notice: Content owner to accept or decline DR

evaluateResolution(uint256,uint8).notice: Approval Authority may accept or reject the 'Resolved' DR

userdoc.notice: This contract will basically track the lifecycle of a Sumbitted DR
